oai_dc:dc.dc:title: A major gene for grain cadmium accumulation in oat
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Tanhuanpää, Pirjo
Kalendar, Ruslan
Schulman, Alan
Kiviharju, Elina
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Breeding, genetics and propagation
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A population of 150 F2 plants was derived from a cross between two spring oat individuals, one from cv. Aslak (Boreal Plant Breeding LTd., Finland) and the other from cv. Salo (Svalöf-Weibull AB, Sweden). Cadmium was tested by inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry (ICP-MS) method.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Tanhuanpää, Pirjo; Kalendar, Ruslan; Schulman, Alan and Kiviharju, Elina (2008) A major gene for grain cadmium accumulation in oat. Poster at: Risk assessment of global agrifood production chains - NJF's 90 year jubilee symposium : NJF seminar 410, Helsinki, Finland, 5-6 November 2008.
